TopicTitle: The Delta IV Orion Launch... RECORDING HERE! (Soon)

Articles.Content: Lots of birds around, hope they don't delay it because of birds.

Lots of birds around, hope they don't delay it because of birds.

Woodpeckers... :D

Sirs, ladies and assorted sentient beings, I do not think it goes to space today. 20 minutes left in the window, and their valve-unsticking adventures have all failed thus far. They are trying though, including going to a manual wind constraint abort rather than computer-based.

Arbitrary units are the best units because your answer is always correct.

They are always wrong in my book, but whatever floats your Delta IV Heavy I view it like unlabelled graph axis: you're never right when you do that.

Did you take the Coriolis effect into account? I only make it 12 liquid hydrogens.

I did, but I bet you forget relativelastics. Those bring it back up again. Without Coriolis you would end up with 16.

Sirs, ladies and assorted sentient beings, I do not think it goes to space today. 20 minutes left in the window, and their valve-unsticking adventures have all failed thus far. They are trying though, including going to a manual wind constraint abort rather than computer-based.

Personally, I don't think that the latter decision is very good. Better be safe than sorry, because this is arguably one of the most important launches that has occurred in years.
They just set up a terminal timer at the end of the window for 9:44 - it's all or nothing this time (until tomorrow anyway)
13 minutes left in the launch window. This doesn't look too good
One last launch attempt! Set for 9:44 AM!
This is it boys, all or nothing.

I would love to se it launch at 9:43:59 am that would be hilarious (the launch deadline is 9:44)

You can predict the future:confused:

You can predict the future:confused:

I have psychic powers
Nine hectares and thirty two inches per cubic gallon of hydrogen has been vented already. That's too much!

I have psychic powers

Psykers? Heresy!

And that's a wrap. They will not go to space today.

See you all tomorrow
24-hour recycle. See you tomorrow.
Well, schuks.
well i guess thats that
Same time? 7:05am EST?
I hope so! I have class tomorrow
I feel bad for zoonamedgames.
Looks like a round of whippings for the ULA engineers who put those valves together...
Anything to do with Valve, blame GabeN.
InB4 the launch! Wait, what? Tomorrow? Yay, I may have a chance to watch the stream. Today I could only keep refreshing this thread. :-)
